document_data.caption: Brassfeather Lane on a circa [[1357 DR]] map of Waterdeep.
document_data.name: Brassfeather Lane
document_data.mainbody: '''Brassfeather Lane''' was a street of hard-packed dirt and [[gravel]]<ref name=CoS.M"> in the [[Waterdeep/North Ward|North Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]].
document_data.Geography:
In the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], this street ran from northeast to southwest, coming off of [[Trollkill Street]] and terminating at [[Immar Street]]. Along the way it acted as the western terminus of [[Anteos Lane]].

In later years, the area that Brassfeather terminated at would be designated as part of [[Thunderstaff Way]].
document_data.History: Brassfeather Lane was named, sometime prior to the 14{{th}} century DR, after a famous smith who had lived along it.{{Cite web/theedverse/2021-11-08 - Brassfeather Lane & Noble Streets}}
document_data.Notable Locations:
* [[Brossfeather Towers]], the family estate of the noble house [[Brossfeather]], which had been constructed along Brassfeather Lane due to its similarity to the noble family's name.
* The home and workshop of [[Huldeth Brassfeather]], the street's namesake.
